      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<!----></span><br><br>	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <span class="line"><!---->	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <!----></span><br>	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<!----></span><br>		<span class="line"><!---->		<!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<span class="line"><!---->		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<!----></span><br>			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<span class="line"><!---->			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<!----></span><br>			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<!----></span><br><br>	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <span class="line"><!---->	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  device->AddActiveExternalTexture(external_texture);<span class="line"><!---->		  device-&gt;AddActiveExternalTexture(external_texture);<!----></span><br><br>	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <!----></span><br>	The GPUExternalTexture object is freed first by :WorkerThread::GCSupport::~GCSupport():<span class="line"><!---->	The GPUExternalTexture object is freed first by :WorkerThread::GCSupport::~GCSupport():<!----></span><br><br><br>	>	chrome.dll!blink::GPUExternalTexture::~GPUExternalTexture() Line 21	C++<span class="line"><!---->	&gt;	chrome.dll!blink::GPUExternalTexture::~GPUExternalTexture() Line 21	C++<!----></span><br>		[Inline Frame] chrome.dll!cppgc::internal::`anonymous namespace'::InlinedFinalizationBuilder<cppgc::internal::(anonymous namespace)::RegularFreeHandler>::AddFinalizer(cppgc::internal::HeapObjectHeader * header, unsigned __int64 size) Line 235	C++<span       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->

          OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<span class="line"><!---->Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<!----></span><br><br><br>cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<span class="line"><!---->cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<!----></span><br>- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <span class="line"><!---->- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <!----></span><br>- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<span class="line"><!---->- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<!----></span><br>- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <span class="line"><!---->- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <!----></span><br>- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<span class="line"><!---->- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<!----></span><br><br>If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<span class="line"><!---->If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">

            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          mr-issue-metadata {

            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;

          }

          }
        }

          </aside>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<!----></span><br><br>	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <span class="line"><!---->	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <!----></span><br>	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<!----></span><br>		<span class="line"><!---->		<!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<span class="line"><!---->		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<!----></span><br>			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<span class="line"><!---->			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<!----></span><br>			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<!----></span><br><br>	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <span class="line"><!---->	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  device->AddActiveExternalTexture(external_texture);<span class="line"><!---->		  device-&gt;AddActiveExternalTexture(external_texture);<!----></span><br><br>	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <!----></span><br>	The GPUExternalTexture object is freed first by :WorkerThread::GCSupport::~GCSupport():<span class="line"><!---->	The GPUExternalTexture object is freed first by :WorkerThread::GCSupport::~GCSupport():<!----></span><br><br><br>	>	chrome.dll!blink::GPUExternalTexture::~GPUExternalTexture() Line 21	C++<span class="line"><!---->	&gt;	chrome.dll!blink::GPUExternalTexture::~GPUExternalTexture() Line 21	C++<!----></span><br>		[Inline Frame] chrome.dll!cppgc::internal::`anonymous namespace'::InlinedFinalizationBuilder<cppgc::internal::(anonymous namespace)::RegularFreeHandler>::AddFinalizer(cppgc::internal::HeapObjectHeader * header, unsigned __int64 size) Line 235	C++<span class="line"><!---->		[Inline Frame] chrome.dll!cppgc::internal::`anonymous namespace'::InlinedFinalizationBuilder&lt;cppgc::internal::(anonymous namespace)::RegularFreeHandler&gt;::AddFinalizer(cppgc::internal::HeapObjectHeader * header, unsigned __int64 size) Line 235	C++<!----></span><br>		[Inline Frame] chrome.dll!cppgc::internal::`anonymous namespace'::SweepNormalPage(cppgc::internal::NormalPage * page, v8::PageAllocator & page_allocator, cppgc::internal::`anonymous namespace'::StickyBits sticky_bits) Line 341	C++<span class="line"><!---->		[Inline Frame] chrome.dll!cppgc::internal::`anonymous namespace'::SweepNormalPage(cppgc::internal::NormalPage * page, v8::PageAllocator &amp; page_allocator, cppgc::internal::`anonymous namespace'::StickyBits sticky_bits) Line 341	C++<!----></span><br>		[Inline Frame] chrome.dll!cppgc::internal::`anonymous namespace'::MutatorThreadSweeper::VisitNormalPage(cppgc::internal::NormalPage & page) Line 563	C++<span class="line"><!---->		[Inline Frame] chrome.dll!cppgc::internal::`anonymous       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          kainino@chromium.org

        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<span class="line"><!---->Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<!----></span><br><br><br>cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<span class="line"><!---->cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342155#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<!----></span><br>- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <span class="line"><!---->- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <!----></span><br>- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<span class="line"><!---->- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<!----></span><br>- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <span class="line"><!---->- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <!----></span><br>- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<span class="line"><!---->- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<!----></span><br><br>If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<span class="line"><!---->If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        This CL is approved for Merge to M104, Please help complete all merges before 3pm PST today ( July 12) so that these can be included in this week's beta release going out tomorrow,.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

            Issue 1342155: Security: Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process.
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1342155: Security: Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process.
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      loobe...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/285938" title="loobe...@gmail.com"><!---->loobe...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      loobe...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->loobe...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 5:39 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 5:39 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          </small>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);

          align-items: stretch;

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<!----></span><br><br>	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <span class="line"><!---->	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <!----></span><br>	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<!----></span><br>		<span         Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<span class="line"><!---->Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<!----></span><br><br><br>cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<span class="line"><!---->cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<!----></span><br>- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <span class="line"><!---->- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <!----></span><br>- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<span class="line"><!---->- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<!----></span><br>- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <span class="line"><!---->- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <!----></span><br>- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<span class="line"><!---->- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<!----></span><br><br>If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<span class="line"><!---->If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>

      </button>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }

          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;

          width: 1px;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

            Issue 1342155: Security: Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process.
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1342155: Security: Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process.
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      loobe...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/285938" title="loobe...@gmail.com"><!---->loobe...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      loobe...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->loobe...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 5:39 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 5:39 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          </small>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<!----></span><br><br>	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <span class="line"><!---->	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <!----></span><br>	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<!----></span><br>		<span class="line"><!---->		<!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<span class="line"><!---->		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<!----></span><br>			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<span class="line"><!---->			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<!----></span><br>			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<!----></span><br><br>	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <span class="line"><!---->	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* device-&gt;AddActiveExternalTexture(external_texture);<!----></span><br><br>	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <!----></span><br>	The GPUExternalTexture object is freed first by :WorkerThread::GCSupport::~GCSupport():<span class="line"><!---->	The GPUExternalTexture object is         Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<span class="line"><!---->Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<!----></span><br><br><br>cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<span class="line"><!---->cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Adding the impact back as WebGPU is shipping in Origin Trial. The bug was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Adding the impact back as WebGPU is shipping in Origin Trial. The bug was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3652008<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3652008"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3652008<!----></a> which has branched in M104 so we'll have to do a cherry-pick.<span class="line"><!----> which has branched in M104 so we'll have to do a cherry-pick.<!----></span><br><br>It seems we'll have to add a pre-finalizer to GPUDevice: <span class="line"><!---->It seems we'll have to add a pre-finalizer to GPUDevice: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/heap/BlinkGCAPIReference.md#using_pre_finalizer<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/heap/BlinkGCAPIReference.md#using_pre_finalizer"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/heap/BlinkGCAPIReference.md#using_pre_finalizer<!----></a><br><br>Tentatively leaving Kai as owner because I'm not going to be able to do a Chromium build today, but feel free to reassign, I can look at it tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively leaving Kai as owner because I'm not going to be able to do a Chromium build today, but feel free to reassign, I can look at it tomorrow.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342155#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
