      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342155#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<!----></span><br>- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <span class="line"><!---->- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <!----></span><br>- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<span class="line"><!---->- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<!----></span><br>- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <span class="line"><!---->- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <!----></span><br>- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<span class="line"><!---->- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<!----></span><br><br>If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<span class="line"><!---->If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Merge review required: M104 is already shipping to beta.<span class="line"><!---->Merge review required: M104 is already shipping to beta.<!----></span><br><br>Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<span class="line"><!---->Please answer the following questions so that we can safely process your merge request:<!----></span><br>1. Why does your merge fit within the merge criteria for these milestones?<!----></span><br>- Chrome Browser: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome Browser: <!----></span>https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches"><!---->https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/branches<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Have the changes been released and tested on canary?<span class="line"><!---->3. Have the changes been released and tested on canary?<!----></span><br>4. Is this a new feature? If yes, is it behind a Finch flag and are experiments active in any release channels?<!----></span><br>5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <span class="line"><!---->5. [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-engprodcomponents<!----></a><br>6. If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->6. If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team?         LTS Milestone M102<span class="line"><!---->LTS Milestone M102<!----></span><br><br>This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<span class="line"><!---->This issue has been flagged as a merge candidate for Chrome OS' LTS channel. If selected, our merge team will handle any additional merges. To help us determine if this issue requires a merge to LTS, please answer this short questionnaire:<!----></span><br>1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<span class="line"><!---->1. Was this issue a regression for the milestone it was found in?<!----></span><br>2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1342155: Security: Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process.
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1342155: Security: Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process.
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      loobe...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->loobe...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<!----></span><br><br>	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line         Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<span class="line"><!---->Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<!----></span><br><br><br>cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<span class="line"><!---->cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<!----></span><br>- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <span class="line"><!---->- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <!----></span><br>- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<span class="line"><!---->- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<!----></span><br>- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <span class="line"><!---->- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <!----></span><br>- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<span class="line"><!---->- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<!----></span><br><br>If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<span class="line"><!---->If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

            Reported by

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<!----></span><br><br>	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <span class="line"><!---->	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <!----></span><br>	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<!----></span><br>		<span class="line"><!---->		<!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<span class="line"><!---->		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<!----></span><br>			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<span class="line"><!---->			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<!----></span><br>			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<!----></span><br><br>	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <span class="line"><!---->	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<!----></span><br>		  ...<span class="line"><!---->		  ...<!----></span><br>		  device->AddActiveExternalTexture(external_texture);<span class="line"><!---->		  device-&gt;AddActiveExternalTexture(external_texture);<!----></span><br><br>	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <!----></span><br>	The GPUExternalTexture object is freed first by :WorkerThread::GCSupport::~GCSupport():<span class="line"><!---->	The GPUExternalTexture object is freed first by :WorkerThread::GCSupport::~GCSupport():<!----></span><br><br><br>	>	chrome.dll!blink::GPUExternalTexture::~GPUExternalTexture() Line 21	C++<span         Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<span class="line"><!---->Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<!----></span><br><br><br>cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<span class="line"><!---->cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Adding the impact back as WebGPU is shipping in Origin Trial. The bug was introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Adding the impact back as WebGPU is shipping in Origin Trial. The bug was introduced in <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3652008<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3652008"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3652008<!----></a> which has branched in M104 so we'll have to do a cherry-pick.<span class="line"><!----> which has branched in M104 so we'll have to do a cherry-pick.<!----></span><br><br>It seems we'll have to add a pre-finalizer to GPUDevice: <span class="line"><!---->It seems we'll have to add a pre-finalizer to GPUDevice: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/heap/BlinkGCAPIReference.md#using_pre_finalizer<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/heap/BlinkGCAPIReference.md#using_pre_finalizer"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/heap/BlinkGCAPIReference.md#using_pre_finalizer<!----></a><br><br>Tentatively leaving Kai as owner because I'm not going to be able to do a Chromium build today, but feel free to reassign, I can look at it tomorrow.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively leaving Kai as owner because I'm not going to be able to do a Chromium build today, but feel free to reassign, I can look at it tomorrow.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      mlippautz@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mlippautz@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342155#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342155#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<!----></span><br>- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <span class="line"><!---->- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <!----></span><br>- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<span class="line"><!---->- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<!----></span><br>- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <span class="line"><!---->- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <!----></span><br>- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<span class="line"><!---->- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<!----></span><br><br>If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<span class="line"><!---->If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<span class="line"><!---->Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<!----></span><br><br><br>cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<span class="line"><!---->cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1342155#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<!----></span><br>- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <span class="line"><!---->- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <!----></span><br>- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<span class="line"><!---->- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<!----></span><br>- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <span class="line"><!---->- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <!----></span><br>- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<span class="line"><!---->- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<!----></span><br><br>If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<span class="line"><!---->If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-7500
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->	Specifically crafted HTML file can trigger Use After Free of GPUExternalTexture object in renderer process. This bug can potentially be exploited to achieve one click Remote Code Execution in renderer process.<!----></span><br><br>	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <span class="line"><!---->	Open the PoC (UAF_GPUExternalTexture_PoC.html) in chrome with command line option "--enable-features=WebGPUService --enable-blink-features=WebGPU". <!----></span><br>	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is initially loaded, a blink object GPUExternalTexture is created for the imported external texture:<!----></span><br>		<span class="line"><!---->		<!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* class="line"><!---->		  GPUExternalTexture* external_texture = GPUExternalTexture::CreateImpl(<!----></span><br>			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<span class="line"><!---->			  device, webgpu_desc, source.media_video_frame, source.video_renderer,<!----></span><br>			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<span class="line"><!---->			  absl::nullopt, exception_state);<!----></span><br><br>	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <span class="line"><!---->	Then, a weak reference (which does not keep the pointed object alive) to this object is added to the active external texture list (active_external_textures_) of object GPUDevice: 	  <!----></span><br>		GPUExternalTexture* GPUExternalTexture::FromVideoFrame(){<span class="line"><!---->		GPUExternalTexture* device-&gt;AddActiveExternalTexture(external_texture);<!----></span><br><br>	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <span class="line"><!---->	When the web page is refreshed, the worker thread is shut down. <!----></span><br>	The GPUExternalTexture object is freed first by :WorkerThread::GCSupport::~GCSupport():<span class="line"><!---->	The GPUExternalTexture object is           <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)

          OS-Android OS-Chrome OS-Fuchsia OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros

        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<span class="line"><!---->Doing stuff from a destructor for a GC-managed object is fraught, it can stick around an arbitrary amount of time before the destructor runs, and it's not well-ordered WRT other objects.<!----></span><br><br><br>cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<span class="line"><!---->cc: oilpan security folks for awareness<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 6, 2022, 11:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for cc. Some clarifications:<!----></span><br>- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <span class="line"><!---->- Destructors in Oilpan are indeed unordered. <!----></span><br>- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<span class="line"><!---->- (Pre-finalizers are actually ordered wrt to registration time but they are way slower.)<!----></span><br>- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <span class="line"><!---->- Worker shutdown generally means the whole heap is unreachable immediately. <!----></span><br>- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<span class="line"><!---->- Staged finalization (Object A is destructed before object B) is brittle, c.f. Hans Boehms work on Java: It's somewhat supported on the main thread (by using Persistent's that are cleared in a finalizer of some object) but definitely not supported on worker where the whole heap is reclaimed at once.<!----></span><br><br>If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<span class="line"><!---->If we have a strong incentive for staged finalization, please file a feature request for Oilpan but generally we would like to keep semantics there simple, in that there's no guarantees.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
